alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Avery; Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Catawba; Cleveland; Davie; Eastern McDowell; Eastern Polk; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; Greater Rutherford; Iredell; Lincoln; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Rowan; Southern Jackson; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 4:10PM EST until January 06 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to an inch, mainly over the mountains, and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of the northwest Piedmont, the mountains of North Carolina, and the South Carolina mountains. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will spread northeast across the region after midnight through the pre-dawn hours. Across the mountains, it will begin as a period of sleet and possibly light snow, before changing to freezing rain and rain. Over the northwest Piedmont, after a brief wintry mix, rain and freezing rain can be expected. The precipitation should change to all rain by late morning.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for freezing rain means that periods of freezing rain or freezing drizzle will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of weather information for the latest updates. Additional details can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp. The latest state road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
